headline: How to Cook a Turkey
description: Learn how to cook a turkey with Chef John's recipe for juicy, perfectly-cooked turkey seasoned with butter, rosemary, and sage and roasted in the oven.

video.description: Learn a simple method for roasting a moist, beautiful turkey.
video.name: How to Roast a Turkey

name: How to Cook a Turkey
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 pound) whole turkey, neck and giblets reserved

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Place onion, celery, and carrot in a large, shallow roasting pan.
Place turkey, breast-side up, on top of vegetables in the roasting pan. Pat outside and inside of turkey dry with paper towels.
Combine salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl. Season inside of turkey with about 1/3 of the salt mixture. Fold wing tips under bird.
Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until edges turn golden, about 2 minutes. Add rosemary and sage; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Place rosemary and sage inside cavity of turkey; reserve melted butter. Tie turkey legs together with twine.
Brush melted butter over turkey. Season with the remaining salt mixture.

Bake turkey, uncovered, in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear, about 3 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C).
Remove turkey from the oven and allow to rest in a warm area for 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: Thank You Chef John! Helped me on Christmas and Thanksgiving, this made me a star amongst friends and family
so it good

I have been using the recipe for ~5 years. I cook for my family, but don’t consider myself to be Uber skilled. Time after time, this recipe has won me accolades at Thanksgiving! I almost panicked when it was 4th down on my google search- need to save this somewhere else. It is so simple, easy, and you legitimately can’t go wrong if you follow the instructions! Thank you for sharing!
Husband said it was the best Turkey he ever had
Tasted like heaven
It was perfect
I used this recipe to cook my 19 pound Christmas turkey and it turned out perfectly! I definitely plan to use this again.
Thank you,turned out awesome
good
It was alright made some changes but overall it was good.

I followed the recipe exactly (aside from using table salt and a poultry seasoning instead of pepper and cayenne) and it turned into a masterpiece. My friends loved it and were impressed with my first bird haha so moist. Tip: leave the oven closed the full 3 or so hours. I had an 11 pound bird and did just over 3 hours.

I made this for the 1st time. this was the most moist turkey I've ever eaten. It was falling off the bone when trying to carve. The only thing I changed was I replaced 2 cups of water with chicken broth. Everyone loved it.
My this year’s Thanksgiving Turkey! Easy and so good !!!Outstanding recipe.
I used this for our Christmas turkey. I’d never cooked a turkey before. It turned out perfectly and the size was perfect for a small family of 3...and we still had leftovers.

I used this recipe for my first ever last year, and we were blown away. It turned out phenomenal and the recipe is so easy.
Last time I made it, I accidentally kept the rosemary in the butter and applied the leaves to the outside, and guess what, best mistake I ever made, it was so delicious. I'm doing it every time now :).
Turned out great. Will use this one again!

This was awesome! My Turkey was just over 13 lbs and took around 3.5 hours. I used dried rosemary and thyme and added Northwoods seasoning from Penzey's into the butter with the rosemary and thyme. I cut up several stalks of celery, several carrots, 3 small onions, and a green apple to rest in the pan because those are all delicious when cooked in the juices along with the Turkey. I also used convection, so I followed the standard guideline of reducing temperature by 25 degrees to 300. My whole family declared it spectacular, including the 6 and 9 year olds.
Followed the recipe, it turned out beautifully.

Delicious, savory, make sure to put some water in the pan under the turkey, why? So your turkey doesn't come out dry. And bend the turkey wings under the turkey so they don't cook crusty, it will be hard to bend so get a strong friend to help you.

I loved this recipe. It was my first turkey that I had to prepare for a big family Christmas dinner and I found the video very calming ;-). I bought a nice organic bird. I substituted fresh herbs for dry. It came out amazingly well and so delicious. Thank you. As the Chef says - it was magazine perfect!
Used this recipe a couple of times now. I’ve put stuffing in with herbs. Loved it both ways! Also bribed first and that made it even better

This turkey was excellent! And, as promised, it was super easy (video was super helpful)! Everyone was complimenting it at Thanksgiving dinner and it indeed looked like a magazine cover (but forgot to get a pic in the scramble of getting everything ready). Thank you, Chef John!
Perfect.
Easy and best turkey I ever made. Thank you. I did use a turkey bag to bake it in though. Yummy.
I made my first turkey this year using this recipe and it turned out great. Our guests all thought it tasted wonderful and wanted the recipe themselves. Thank you!

This was the best Turkey Recipe EVER!!! I followed it exactly but left out the Cayenne pepper. I was amazed at how much gravy this method made it was so amazing. We love gravy and never get enough. This method made the most delicious turkey and gravy. I had so many compliments this year. I wish All Recipes would take all their 5 star recipes and make a large cookbook. Please do this and you will get my sale for sure.
This was a huge hit! I followed the instructions and ingredients exactly and it was amazing! Everyone raved about the taste and appearance. I’ll never make another turkey any other way than this one.
First turkey I made since my divorce, and this was the best! So much easier and better than the traditional “slow and low” people tout. Try it you won’t be disappointed!!
Easy and delicious! I used Tastefully Simple Rustic Herb seasoning instead of fresh herbs because my grocery store was completely out with the Thanksgiving holiday. It turned out so delicious!
I followed directions exactly. It was done cooking in less than 3 hours. Next time I will get a meat thermometer as recommended.

Never cooked a turkey on a bed of vegetables, but it was great and will now be my go-to method! I wasn't getting much juice while cooking, so added some turkey stock to bottom of the pan so that I could baste. Delicious. Also did pretty much the same thing with a turkey breast (lots of white meat eaters in this group and needed some extra!). With the breast, I put lots of butter under the skin. Thanks for this idea!

With the help of viewing the video first, this made for fairly simple preparation considering it was a last-minute decision to find a fool-proof, simple recipe. And turned out to be one of the best turkeys I've ever made! Mine was a 21 pounder but I still think I could have used a little less of the seasoning amounts called for the 12 pounder here. Nevertheless, the drippings plus some low-sodium chicken broth made for an excellent gravy. I may even be a little more intentional about the carrots next year and pick them out for a very delicious and colorful side dish.

Great Starter for a beginner/novice. I added and adjusted, but the basics of this recipe will yield a perfect bird for family. I followed this recipe to a tee, but added 2 quarters of fresh naval orange, 2 quarters of sweet yellow onion, Five fresh, uncut garlic cloves, and also added garlic, rosemary, thyme, and sage to the butter reduction. I also added some rubbed sage to the salt, pepper, and cayenne. I know I’m going on and on, but I also doubled the amount of fresh veggies for the bed in the pan, and added pats of butter just under the skin of the bird. I slowed the cook time by going with 300°. And let me tell you, it was the best turkey I ever made! Thank you for the basis of this recipe, and never be afraid to add to it a little!!

This is close to how I do my turkey, but I stuff two apples (big slices) in my bird (keeps it super moist). Then when it comes to roasting, cover mine with foil to start with, then uncover for the last hour, basting every 15 mins. Keeps the skin crisp and doesn’t burn.
I didn’t use the celery, onion, or carrots. Also I didn’t have fresh sage. However this is the BEST turkey I’ve ever made. There were no leftovers!! I did use an oven bag to keep it moist.

I made this with a 14.3 lb turkey and it turned out great! I didn’t have the fresh ingredients to stuff the bird with so I just used the salt mixture. We had stuff to do away from home so I put it in the oven before we left and had it in for between 3-4 hours. I was super pleased with the results! I was able to use the broth in my pan for my gravy and didn’t need to add any seasonings to it.. was great as-is.... super easy recipe for how good the results were!

My cooking abilities are limited to pasta & putting premade meals in the oven. With minimal help I made this turkey & it was delicious. 11.5 pound turkey was in the oven for 2 hours 40 minutes. Thank you so much it was inexpensive & easy to follow!

Thank you so much for this recipe! I always felt completely incompetent to cook a nice turkey but this recipe makes it easy and straightforward and all the flavors are delicious. I didn't have fresh herbs on hand so subbed dry rosemary and thyme. Also didn't have cayenne so subbed red chile powder.

OMG!!!!!! I have cooked many birds before but this recipe beats every recipe I’ve ever done! (in fact, I threw out every other turkey recipe I have!) No brining, smoking, deep frying to get a super moist, tasty bird—just use this recipe. The only thing I did do was to cook my 21lb bird an oven bag (due to a time crunch) for about 3 1/2 hours at 350. I had planned to remove it from the bag and cook it the last half hour uncovered (as oven bagged birds have not given me the golden brown color (see photo—taken just out of from the oven) I’m looking for), but when I opened the oven my bird was perfect! Thank you Chef John for this amazing recipe! Now I look forward to cooking my next turkey instead of dressing it:)
A very simple recipe to follow!! And turned out amazing! Everyone enjoyed the turkey including our dogs that got a small treat!!
Last Christmas I made my first turkey using this recipe. It was a hit! Juice, favourful and VERY simple. Will be making it again this Easter.

First time cooking a turkey and it's a huge success! Only variation I did is use more butter and next time I might step it up a little more, 6 tablespoons, since the rosemary and sage soak a lot of it up. Not sure if I'm biased since I cooked it but it's the most delicious turkey I've had in my life!

I have made this recipe 3 or 4 times now so clearly it's a winner! My only deviation is that I always add a Granny Smith apple to the veggies in which the turkey cooks. I've also used jar spices for the Rosemary & Sage when I forgot to buy fresh and could not face another trip to the store. It's an acceptable substitute and I don't kick myself for it. The turkey is always tender and NOT DRY (yay!) and falls off the bone. My hubby and 5 boys love it and more importantly I love it. HA! Thanks!
Used this recipe for my first turkey ever. It was amazingly flavorful and delicious!!
I made this in a turkey bag and it was excellent.

Absolutely wonderful!!!! I did a few things different. I added the salt and peppers to the melted butter instead of sprinkling the seasonings over the buttered turkey, and it came out a beautiful, all over, roasted brown. I did not have sprigs of rosemary, so I used my dried rosemary and sage, lightly chopped, moistened, rubbed inside and place remaining inside the turkey. The gravy was very salty, so I plan to adjust the salt in the giblet broth instead of on the turkey. however, I did not stuff the turkey and that may change the saltiness. I plan to only bake a turkey this way in the future. It was that good!

I make a turkey once every couple weeks as meal prep for my dog and there's no other recipe that tastes as good as this one. Although I swap out the onion for beets for my dogs health I always save my favourite parts of the turkey for myself. The spice mix and cooking time are always perfect and I've never once had any issues. My dog especially gives this recipe 10/10
I’ve used these instructions to cook a whole turkey and a bone in breast. It’s simply delicious!
Followed the recipe nearly to the letter. Juiciest turkey I have ever made. Thank you!!

I’ve made a few turkeys over the years. This is the absolute best one I’ve eve made! I only had to make a minor change. I used dried herbs since I didn’t have fresh. I received a lot of compliments. This recipe is a keeper!!!

Omg!! Poultry is my nemesis!! This has been the best Turkey I have ever done!! Thank you Chef John his recipes never disappoint. I seasoned my turkey to my liking and injected it with Mojo. Covered it with bacon weave and stuffed it with a whole apple garlic and half a sour orange. I cooked it at 325° for 3 & half hours it was 15lb pounder at the 3 hour mark I checked for temp, breast was done but legs needed about 5 degrees. I covered the breast with aluminum foil. I did let the bird rest for a good hour before carving... I was amazed at house juice it was and completely cooked... I also tried not to open the oven door at all.
my first turkey, came out great! I was nervous, but it was super easy. I added a sliced lemon with the vegetables for my own flare

I cooked a turkey using this recipe for Thanksgiving and I was most pleased with it. I followed directions and in return yielded a delicious juicy and beautiful turkey. Everyone enjoyed it and this is now the recipe for me for now on.
Tasted great but unfortunately I over cooked the Turkey and it was dry.
I've made Thanksgiving turkey for many years. This was the best method I've found yet! Turned out better than brine and it was much easier.

This was my first time cooking a turkey, and it was PERFECTION. It was so super juicy and incredibly flavorful. (And I don’t usually like turkey)

I followed others’ advice and 1. lessened the cayenne pepper, and 2. cooked it on 400 flipped breast down for one hour, and then 325 for 2 hours and voila! DeLISH!
Used this recipe to cook my first turkey. It came out amazing! Moist and full of flavor. My stove is small and gets hotter than regular ovens, so I reduced time to be 12 min per pound.
I covered the breast with foil and about halfway through i uncovered it. This helped keep the breast real moist. The turkey was perfect. By far the best I've made yet.
Good turkey! Veery juicy .
I'm not big on rosemary or carrots with turkey but I used everything else and it turned out great!

WOW! My husband and I cooked our very first turkey and thanks to Chef Jeff and Allrecipes it came out absolutely stunning in presentation and flavor by following recipe ingredients and watching the video which made it so easy for beginners like us !!! We are now excited to try other recipes from your site and want to wish you all a very happy thanksgiving!!!!!
I use this recipe every year and have always had a wonderful and juicy turkey.

Delicious. I followed the directions except that I had some thyme to add in and I also cooked mine in a turkey bag, so I followed the temp/time for the bag instead of those here. Worked very well. Moist and delicious. The cayenne adds just the right amount of kick.

I followed the instructions and then added a few things. The instructions are EXTREMELY EASY to follow. I also made my own stuffing and stuffed the turkey. I cooked it for almost 3 hours and it came out perfect. I used a 12 lb turkey and it was moist. I set it to the temperature indicated.

For the person who says their turkey was not cooked after 3 hours, I would have to say it's the oven. All ovens are different but most should cook a 12lb turkey after 2 1/2 hours.

I also used the popout timer. I place one on the thickest part of the thigh and another at the thickest part of the breast. The thigh timer popped first and then 20 minutes later the breast timer popped. I left it in the oven, turned off for an additional 10 minutes and the turkey was to perfection. My guests could not stop complementing how moist and delicious the turkey was. I am happy with this recipe and will continue to use it. Also this is the second time in my life I made a turkey. The first time was 22 years ago, followed a Betty Crocker recipe and this time I used this recipe. Both times it came out super delicious!

I have been cooking turkeys for many years and they come out pretty well in terms of moisture and flavor. However, I've never been able to cook one where the Turkey looked evenly golden brown and so pretty. This recipe is so easy to follow and I was happy with my results. 

I didn't have fresh sage or rosemary. My go-to store was out. So I mixed 2 teaspoons of ground sage and crushed rosemary into the butter when I melted it. I used the same spices to coat two chopped up celery stalks in a bowl and then stuffed the raw Turkey with the coated celery. That way my Turkey was able to still get a good, aromatic flavor from inside the cavity as it cooked. This recipe is a keeper! Thank you Chef John!
awesome and easy and bursting with flavor! this will be my 6th year making it, per everyone's request!!
First timer last year, this was an amazing and easy recipe. Excellent turkey - doing it again this year!

I made this yet again. It turned out great, again. I love all of the spices, but it does make a gravy that is a little too spicy. I added chicken stock to my gravy this time and less drippings, and it turned out perfectly! I love this recipe. I love chef John, and I am so grateful for this site.

My turkey turned out quite well after all for me. I had mixed all dry ingredients in the butter and I rubbed the Turkey with it and baste a few times during cooking.

Quite good, actually. Thank you for posting. :-)

I followed the recipe and it came out looking like something you would see in a magazine. It was so juicy and delicious. Everyone came running with their phones. It was a 25 lb bird and gone the next day.

I was so excited about this recipe because it got such rave reviews. Honestly, the turkey flavor was fine, but the gravy was so stinkin' hot. Definitely not your traditional turkey recipe. Next time, I won't use the cayenne.
The taste is perfect, it was a little too spicy for my kids so next time will have to cut down on cayenne pepper
Super easy and great instructions
The only recipe you'll ever need!

I have to say this.... I wish I could hang with Chef John, without him ...and countless others on this site my family would starve! I wouldn't get a man through his stomach, I wouldn't get teenagers to remain at the table and the most of all I wouldn't get the approval of crusty elderly people I have learned so much and I thank you.
Easy to follow recipe and delicious! We had a 15 pound turkey and cooked it on convection.. it was done in 3 hours!
Hi, I am looking forward to making this. What is the cooking time if I add stuffing

I made it on a rack instead of on top of veggies. No one could believe how beautifully golden and moist it was! It stayed moist through reheating for multiple days! Saved for my ONLY way to roast a turkey! Its all about the thermometer I think. I am going to buy the oven proof kind just so I dont keep poking it, but it was still PERFECT!

I made it on a rack instead of on top of veggies. No one could believe how beautifully golden and moist it was! It stayed moist through reheating for multiple days! Saved for my ONLY way to roast a turkey! Its all about the thermometer I think. I am going to buy the oven proof kind just so I dont keep poking it, but it was still PERFECT!

Delicious, but too salty for our taste (and we enjoy salt).
The cayenne pepper was a nice change. If you taste the dry spice mix it will be spicy, but once cooked on the turkey - it was very nice and not at all too spicy.
I used a 16.5 pound turkey and followed the recipe exactly (exception: recipe calls for 12 pound turkey and I only had fine Sea Salt). 
I think had I used this on a 12 pound turkey, I'd be rating it lower than four stars because it would have been SO salty.
The next time I make this I will reduce the salt to 1 Tablespoon or perhaps slightly rounded Tablespoon. ( I used Bob's Red Mill Sea Salt. I have used Kosher salt before and although the Kosher was a tad larger grain - I believe it would still have been too salty). 
Next time I make this I will reduce the salt (to amount mentioned above) but, I will keep everything else as the recipe lists. Also, this recipe would be delicious with a roast chicken in place of turkey.

Good recipe for flavour. I will definitely do this again. My problem was the temp. For an 11 lbs unstuffed turkey, it took 4 hours, and it was still iffy by the bone. 
I will start my next one at 400 F, breast down for 1 hour. Then flip it breast side up, reduce temp to 325 F for 2 more hours. 
This is my tried and true method, and the meat literally falls off the bone. 
Looking forward to combining these recipes. Yum!
This is a simple and good recipe. I also tried the gravy that Chef John made and it was good as well!
It was easy and turned out perfectly!

Great turkey recipe. The herbs and butter are what make it shine.

Cook 20 minutes per pound.

Aloha. I followed the recipe but I didn't use the vegetables on the bottom. I used a wire rack but to add height to it I thickly sliced potatoes and placed it under. The potatoes actually cooked with the juices from the turkey. The salt, blk pepper & cayenne mixture plus the sage and rosemary really added great flavor to the turkey. In the final half 45 minutes I basted the turkey with the juices causing the skin to have a beautiful crunch. Great and easy recipe.
Simple and great!

This turned out good. Mild herb flavor since the herbs were inside verses rubbed under the skin like other recipes. I did cover my bird in the beginning b/c it was a 20lb and I didn't want it to get too brown. The gravy from the drippings was way too salty for our taste though so I would reduce the salt by half for our taste.

I got all the way to the end and realized we forgot to get white wine.... I subbed light beer (coors light) and it still came out AMAZING. My husband said it's the first 'non boring' turkey he's ever had, lol. I think it was the best turkey I've had too. After the brine sat for 12 hrs I discarded the liquid & let the turkey 'dry out' over night in the fridge... this helps it brown better. It was picture perfect! It was just 2 of us and a little, so we did a turkey breast & scaled the recipe.
This recipe was a huge hit for my fiancé and I first thanksgiving feast! We will definitely make it again.
Followed exactly and it turned out perfect. My husband said best turkey he has ever had, this is a keeper recipe!
My turkey turned out perfectly!

I can't say enough. I never enjoyed turkey until tonight! It was beyond moist and delicious. I seasoned with 1 tbsp salt 1 tbsp pepper and 1 t bsp of my favorite grill seasoning. I also rubbed some of the herbed butter and rubbed under the skin as well as on the outside.
I made the perfect turkey last thanksgiving using this recipe. I now routinely use it to roast the perfect chicken, each and every time throughout the year.
No more bags, brine, or basting! This came out perfect with no effort at all! The hardest part was opening the turkey bag. lol I give it 6 stars! :)

I wish I could give this 10 stars!! It was SO easy and turned out better than ANY turkey I've ever had. I made this recipe for Thanksgiving since my mom has passed the torch to me and I was worried mine wouldn't turn out like hers does. But she loved it and told me it was the best turkey she had in her whole life. It was a huge compliment and everyone one else felt the same! Look no further for a great recipe!

I made my first turkey with this recipe and it came out perfectly! I added a bit more butter, seasoning, doubled the herbs and added thyme to baste turkey with and total cook time was 4.5 hours. It turned out beautifully! This is going to be my go-to recipe for turkey.
Only recipe I tried, it was my first attempt at a turkey, I didn't have all the ingredients, but it came out delicious anyway! Thank you!!
Most delicious turkey every! Shshshshsh, don't tell Grandma! ;)

Chef John, thank you! This was my first turkey and it was amazing. I was a little scared not placing the turkey in a bag like my mom did when I was younger, and I'm so glad I didn't. This turkey was wonderful. I'm not going to bore people with what I did differently. By the way, I only changed a few spices to our taste and fresh herbs. The timing was perfect, the bird was excellent, and you made me a professional!
